New Records: Rhett Lowder's rookie season comes to an end with a 1.17 ERA in six starts.
Key Match Events: The Cubs shut the Reds out for a second consecutive game.
Dansby Swanson had 5 errors and a 0.990 fielding percentage in 147 games at short this year.
The Reds' offense managed just three hits on the day.
Elly De La Cruz made a charging play and fired home to get the force out.
Pete Crow-Armstrong followed up with a line drive into center for an RBI single.
The Cubs picked up another run on a 4-pitch walk.
Pre-Game Insights: There were no pre-game insights mentioned in the article.
Post-Match Reflections: The Reds are now in last place, tied with the Pittsburgh Pirates at 76-85 on the year.
Cincinnati's final game will be against the Cubs, while the Pirates face the Yankees.
The Reds are eligible to get the 1st Pick on the draft since they got the 2nd in the draft lottery.
Justin Wilson Is made of gasoline.
The Reds should very seriously conduct very serious interviews for a new manager.
The Reds need a change in principal ownership.
The Castellini family may be amenable to selling the managing partner share if they can find a buyer they trust.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Reds' team ops in 3 months was bottom 5 in the league.
The Reds are eligible for one of the lottery picks this year, as they have had only one lottery pick in the last two years.
The Reds' pitching has been pretty darn good overall for the season.
The Reds' offense is a major concern.
Elly De La Cruz is one of the best defensive SS in baseball.
